meanings.definition: The pages at the beginning and end of a book that are glued to the inside covers.
meanings.sent1: The endpapers of the book were white and smooth.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy the colorful endpapers in my favorite novels.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat used the endpapers as a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were written on the endpapers of her life's story.
meanings.sent5: The endpapers, like a secret door, held the key to the book's world.
